Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Alloferon 2 (Alloferon-2; Gly-rich, classic His-rich; metallo-AMPs; natural anti-cancer, other BAPs, insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBII)

Literature Information.Literature: Metal coordination: the N-terminal amine, the three imidazoles of H1, H6, and H9 participate in the coordination of Zn(II) (Dudek et al., 2020).Sequence analysis:  It is a classic His-rich peptide (25%). It's N-terminally truncated form of alloferon 1.Activity: During screening, it was found to be cytotoxic against cancer cells but not further chracterized yet. Updated 9/2017; 12/2017; 6/2022
Literature Information.Author: Chernysh S, Kim SI, Bekker G, Pleskach VA, Filatova NA, Anikin VB, Platonov VG, Bulet P.2002
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 2002; 99 (20):12628-32.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Novel antiviral and antitumoral peptides from insects.
